page.title: 11St. Katherine's Knockholt
page.content: St Katherine's Church is over seven hundred years old. It was built on the site of a ruined Norman church by a certain Ralph Scott in the parish of Ocolte, as Knockholt was then called, "because of the many Perils of Souls" that befell parishoners when they travelled to their parish church at Orpington, and was consecrated in May 1281. The yew tree in the churchyard is about as old as the church. The parish registers date from 1548,only ten years after Cromwell introduced such registers. The fine organ has recently been completely renovated. The church today is substanially as it was when bulit seven hundred years ago, with the addition of the tower and North Aisle. Apart from the usual Anglican services, the Roman Catholic community use the building for their service on Sunday afternoon.
